settings.title: The Sweet Tooth That Started It All
settings.content:
My name is Yaniv Simpson, and this is the story of how The Conscious Bar came to be.

Let me take you back to the beginning—when a five-year-old version of me got banned from a candy store. Why? Because even then, I loved chocolate with a passion that defied limits. Fast forward a few years, and 12-year-old me was sitting in a dentist’s chair, staring down six cavities after yet another chocolate binge. Clearly, my sweet tooth wasn’t going anywhere.

settings.title: Dreams Beyond Sweets
settings.content:
Around that same time, I fell in love with basketball. It became my obsession, my dream. I gave it everything I had—countless hours on the court, relentless training, and a fierce determination to make it as a pro. But after four surgeries and some harsh realities, it was time to let go.

There I was, an adult with an insatiable love for chocolate and a deep, true respect for my health. And then it hit me… if I wasn’t going to stop eating chocolate, maybe I could reinvent it.

settings.title: What If Chocolate Could Be Better?
settings.content:
What if chocolate could taste just as incredible—better even—but also serve as something that’s actually good for me?

That’s when the gears started turning. First, I needed the best cacao in the world—something pure, rich, magical—cacao that embodies everything I’ve ever loved about the experience of chocolate. Then came the big question: what would I use to sweeten it? Being Middle Eastern, the answer was almost too obvious: Dates. Sweet, velvety, natural, and nutrient-packed, they were the perfect complement.

settings.title: From the Kitchen to The Conscious Bar
settings.content:
With some help from a friend, armed with a countertop chocolate refiner I bought off Amazon for $250, I dove into my first batch. The result… let’s just say, not that great. But I saw the potential. So I kept pushing.

From there, the next move was obvious—I needed to find the manufacturer to get this recipe alive and kicking. After eight months of refining the recipe, I could finally say with confidence that we had created the absolute most delicious chocolate I’ve ever tasted. Finally, there it was—The Conscious Bar was born.

settings.title: From a Sweet Tooth to a Global Mission
settings.content:
It started as a selfish endeavor: I wanted absolute free range to pig out on insanely delicious chocolate without the guilt. But the moment I took that first bite, I knew this was bigger than me. This was something I had to share with the world. Three and a half years later, with a team whose sole mission is to redefine the ultimate chocolate experience, I believe we’re doing exactly that. 

Welcome to the future of chocolate.

settings.title: Research & Development
settings.content: Our founder began doing R&D with a counter-top refiner in a NYC Apartment. Though the initial results weren't great, i could see the potential.

settings.title: Finding A Manufacturer
settings.content: After understanding the skills required to make incredible chocolate, our founder found a chocolatier and began creating our original recipe.

settings.title: The Conscious Bar Launches In Miami
settings.content: After the original recipe & packaging were created, The Conscious Bar launched in Miami with our 4 original flavors: Smooth Dark Chocolate, Toasted Coconut Flakes, Roasted Hazelnut, & Almond Sea Salt

settings.title: 3 New Flavors Are Introduced
settings.content: The Conscious Bar extends offering to our 7 core flavors, adding in Creamy Tahini, Espresso Crunch, & Orange Blossom

settings.title: Our Nation-Wide Launch
settings.content: After testing our local market & figuring out how to ship chocolate sustainably and efficiently, we began getting chocolate into the hands of chocolate lovers across the US.

settings.title: The Conscious Bar 2.0
settings.content: The Conscious Bar re-brands & launches version 2.0 into the world, entering the market with a fresh look that allows for customers to identify our mission in a heartbeat. Plus, we were able to bring our price down to $10.
